intro: Magnistipula eglandulosa, commonly known as the smooth-stippled magnolia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its simple, elliptical leaves that are smooth along the edges and have a stippled appearance on the upper surface. The plant produces showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. Its growth habit is typically shrub-like, with multiple stems and dense foliage. The botanical features of Magnistipula eglandulosa make it a notable species within the Magnoliaceae family.
